document_data.name: Grape
document_data.mainbody: '''Grapes''' were a variety of fruit found in the Realms. When dried up they were known as '''raisins'''.
document_data.Description: Grapes grew in bubble formations. They were suitable for growing in drier soil.

Availability.Beyond Faerûn:
* In the [[Hordelands]], grapes were cultivated along mountain slopes in the kingdom of [[Delmyr]]{{Cite dragon/269/The New Adventures of Volo: Hin Nobody Knows|85}} and in the [[Merket Depression]]. Wild grapes could be found growing in the [[Katakoro Plateau]], And raisins could be found traded all across the Hordelands by caravans.<ref>
* In the [[Crowded Sea]], grapes were cultivated on the isle of [[Masud Jazayir]]. 
* Grapes were grown in [[Zakhara]], with raisins being a common food item.
* Grapes and [[olive]]s were a major produce of the lush and disputed regions of the [[Hills of Apion]] and the [[Valley of Umbricci]] in the [[Blade Kingdoms]] of [[Vilhon Reach]].
Availability.Beyond Toril:
* In the [[plane]] of [[Arborea]], grapes grew in along the hills of the layer [[Olympus]] and over runned the palace of [[Dionysus]].
* Grapes could be found in the land of [[Barovia]].

Species.Exeltis family grapes:
a species of small grey grapes grown on the lands of the [[Exeltis]] clan along the [[Blade Cliffs]] in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]].

Another unique species of grapes could be found in the sunless [[Underdark]]. [[Drow]] used it to create a type of rare wine called [[deepwine]].

document_data.Diseases: [[Disease]]s affecting grapes included [[vine-blight]] and [[blackweb]], a fungal blight occurring on grape vines grown in cold, damp environments.{{Cite polyhedron/57/The Everwinking Eye: At Home in Maskyr's Eye|20}}
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1252}}, the vine-blight ravished many grape orchards across large portions of Faerûn, depriving people that year of wine. In the Purple Hills, the either unaware or unsympathetic Duke of [[Ankramir]] and demanded the usual number of [[cask]]s from the peasantry. The vintners and farmers refused to pay the levy and tried to sell their meager harvest in the North, where demand and prices where high, in an attempt to recoup some of their losses. The duke sent soldiers to confiscate the wine, only to see the casks broken and tossed into the [[Sea of Swords]] in what later became known as the [[Battle of the Broken Vats]].

Around the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], [[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-universe)|''Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue'']] sold a variety of grape products. These included raisins from the lands of Berdusk, Saerloon, and Selgaunt for five [[gold piece]]s, one gold piece, and five [[silver piece]]s respectively. As well as brandied grapes from Imnescar, fruitcakes that contained raisins, spiced wines made with raisins, and winter wine.

Usage.Food:
* Throughout the Realms grapes were pressed into a fluid form to create a wide variety of [[wine]]s.
** In the town of [[Ashabenford]], the winery [[Arlho's Fine Flasks]] used green grapes to produce a wine known as [[Pearls of the Moon]].<ref>
** In the Cormyrian city of [[Arabel]], grapes were used to make a wine known as [[Arabellan Dry]].
** In Berdusk, grapes were used to make a wine known as [[Berduskan Dark]].
** In the nation of Aglarond, grapes were used to make [[blood wine]].
** Grapes grown in the Merket Depression were used to make sweet wines.
** In the Old Empires region, grapes were used to make [[Fire Wine]].
** The fire grapes of Phlegethos Were used to make infernal wine.
** In the Unapproachable East, the [[Wychlaran]] used grapes specially grown on plantations near the city of [[Urling]] to make [[jhuild]].
** In the Sembian city of Saerloon, grapes were used to make a variety of wines that included [[Saerloonian Glowfire]], [[Saerloonian Special Vat]], and [[Saerloonian Topaz]].
** In Calimshan and Tethyr, some varieties of [[spiced wine]] were made with raisins.
** In the North, people made [[Winter Wine]] by allowing grapes to freeze on the vine before harvesting and then crushing them.
* In the wine making process there were always grape skins left behind. These wet mashes were often used as a form of marinade for meats.
* Grapes were used by halflings in Corm Orp to make [[dye]]s for export.
* Grapes were used to make [[fruit jelly|fruit jellies]] in the Shining South and Lands of Intrigue.
* Grapes were part of the recipe for the dish [[Ladies' Fowl]].
* Raisins were sometimes included in [[Ration|dry provisions]].<ref>
* Raisins were often used in [[fruitcake]]s.
* The [[Shad'iar]], the nomadic tribes of the Land of the Lions, used grapes in the brewing of a beverage they called [[hadii]].

document_data.Notable Users:
[[File:Zardoz.jpg|thumb|273px|''Green grapes sit in a bowl alongside other fruits on the table of [[Zardoz Zord]].'']]
* The [[Bacchae]] typically wore vegetative crowns that were sometimes made of grape leaves.
* Many [[elf|elven]] cities and towns cultivated grapes.
* The typical halfling dinner often featured table grapes.
* Raisins were a popular handfood in the Western Heartlands and along the coast of the Sea of Fallen Stars.<ref>{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2007)/Handfoods of the Realms}}
* The [[Red Sheaf]] and the [[Twelve Dancing Knights]] served their patrons grapes.
document_data.Trivia:
* The city of [[Nimpeth]] had a militia known as the [[Company of the Crushed Grapes]].Vilhon Reach
* The coat of arms of the [[Ravens Bluff|Ravenian]] noble family [[Cathone]] was a cluster of grapes hanging downward.
* [[Winemaker genie]]s were [[tasked genie]]s whose lives were dedicated to nurturing grape vines and making wine from them. They used their long trunks to crush them. They drape themselves in grape leaves during the growing season.
